channel.title: Integrated Climate and Land-Use Scenarios
channel.description: Updated Integrated Climate and Land-Use Scenarios content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: ICLUS Data for the Northwest Region
item.description:
• Northwest
  • Southwest
  • Northern Plains
  • Southern Plains
  • Midwest
  • Northeast
  • Southeast

Northwest Region

The Northwest region includes ID, OR, and WA.

ICLUS data (version 2) outputs made available to the regional groups of the National Climate Assessment consist of populations. The projections are based on the 2010 U.S. Census and use fertility, mortality and immigration rates from the Wittgenstein Centre Exit to project decadal population to 2100. These projections are therefore consistent with the demographic assumptions of the SSP2 and SSP5 socioeconomic scenarios. ICLUS population projections are used as inputs to a land use model, which spatially allocates five residential land uses (exurban-low, exurban-high, suburban, urban-low, urban-high) as well as commercial and industrial.

Datasets available below cover the Northwest region. All datasets are compatible with standard geographic information systems.

Dataset to download Description Metadata
Population Data (SSP2 & SSP5) 964Kb, Shapefile format Population Projections

The graphs below provide an overview of population and developed land area trends across the two scenarios, SSP2 and SSP5, over time for the Northwest region.

Download Population Trend Data using ICLUS Version 2 Datasets(1 pg, 42 K)
Download Developed Landuse Data using ICLUS Version 2 Datasets(1 pg, 52 K)
item.dc:creator: mjohns05

item.title: ICLUS Podcast Transcript
item.description:
This is the transcipt of the 3:51 minute podcast about an overview of the Integrated Climate and Land-Use Scenarios Project.

Speaker is Philip Morefield of the Global Climate Research Program in the National Center for Environmental Assessment (NCEA).
NCEA is a national center in the Office of Research and Development (ORD).

  • EPA ICLUS Podcast Transcript (PDF)(2 pp, 72 K, 08-13-2012)
item.dc:creator: mjohns05

item.title: ICLUS Data for the Midwest Region (V.1)
item.description:
• Northwest
  • Southwest
  • Great Plains
  • Midwest
  • Northeast
  • Southeast

Midwest Region

The Midwest region includes IA, IL, IN, MI, MN, MO, OH, and WI.

ICLUS data made available to the Regional groups of the National Climate Assessment consists of population and housing density. Population data are based on the 2000 U.S. Census and use fertility rates from the Census Bureau to project population to 2100 in 5-year time steps for each county in the conterminous United States. By using high and low fertility rates, scenarios are consistent with A2 and B1 scenarios, respectively. The population data are used as inputs to a spatial allocation model, which produces maps of housing density. These data are classified into four categories of urban, suburban, exurban, and rural. The resolution of these data is 1 hectare.

Datasets available here cover the Midwest region. All data are compatible with standard Geographic Information Systems (GIS).

Dataset to download Description Metadata
Population Data (A2 & B1 files) 393 K, Shapefile format County Population Projections
A2 Housing Density Data 92.1 MB, GRID format Housing Density Projections (Classified)
B1 Housing Density Data 93.1 MB, GRID format Housing Density Projections (Classified)

The graphs below provide an overview of population and housing density trends across the two scenarios, A2 and B1, over time for the Midwest region.

Download Population Trends By Region Spreadsheet (XLS)(85K)
Download Housing Density Trends By Region Spreadsheet (XLS) (141K)
item.dc:creator: mjohns05
